Once there, you feel an overwhelming desire to thank your family. You find them all in the living room, and say, "Thank all of you for existing."

"Why would you say something crazy like that?" your mother says. "I don't know, I just had a weird feeling that this day could have gone drastically different, and that something bad could have happened to all of you," you reply.

"Whatever," your brother Todd says, and goes back to playing his video game. You decide to head back to your room and finish doing the homework that you felt you haven't done in ages. About two hours later, your mother opens your door and brings in both your girlfriend, Michelle, and best friend, Anna, who had came over to study for the test you were supposed to have the following day. After studying (and kissing Michelle goodbye) you sit down and have a nice uneventful dinner with your family.

Years later, you look back and site this as one of the best days as your life, but you can't pinpoint why. You and Michelle have a loving family, 2 sons and 2 daughters. You never heard anyone else talk about a sword in a stone near your town, nor did you really care, as it was probably still lodged in that stone.

Who knows? Maybe somebody else will find it one day?

155332211111121.content:
WWIII, what a time. What started out as a mistake nuclear missile launch, caused by a scientist being distracted by a mass murder case on TV from his home town, quickly escalated to the destruction of the entire multiverse. First, the waters became polluted with radiation, while nuclear fallout slowly killed all those left alive, wiping out nearly 90% of the world population. Those that were left struggled to avoid radiation, and to find supplies in their ever dwindling rations. Animals mutated, but quickly died out as well, leaving even less food source available. Next, the plants died out, and it was eventually the loss of oxygen that caused the last humans to die.

And the world remained this way for hundreds, if not thousands of years, until the sword awoke it's true nature. After the first one hundred years had passed, the sword reset itself, just as the never read manual had said. After an undeterminable amount of time, (Everyone had stopped keeping track of time long before 100 years had passed) the sword activated the failsafe installed by Wsxol thousands of years before. If it could not detect a master, the sword was to return to Wsxol.

Wsxol, being the wizard that he was, did not realize that he, just like all of humanity, was mortal. So, the sword, looking desperately for its master began doing what it did best. It began slicing.

It sliced between the bonds between universes, searching desperately for one that held its master. It passed through 10, 20, 50, 100, 1,000 universes, with no luck. And for infinity, it sliced onwards, always looking, always hoping, never finding what it so desperately required.

However, what the sword was unaware of, is that the bonds between universes are very fragile, and that the destruction of these bonds would have cataclysmic effects.

They would start out as something simple. A person slipping through the cracks into a world they don't belong in. Technology from the future falling through time into the past. The revival of extinct species. However, these events continued to compound and compound, until the very structure of the multiverse itself collapse.

Infinite amounts of innocent life forms died. Infinite towns, worlds, planets were demolished in seconds. Chaos reigned supreme. Nobody in any multiverse was safe until the sword found what it was looking for, which it never did.

And all because, you, the reader, could not make a simple choice.

15533311.content:
Well, if you gained the power to move stuff with your mind you wouldn't really need arms any more, right? You could just use your psychokinesis for all of that sort of stuff. You remove your shirt, not wanting to damage the sleeves, and take the blade in your right hand. With one deep breath you sweep the blade upwards and your left arm drops off right at the shoulder. Immediately something goes off within you, a tingling sensation in your brain as if a light switch had been flicked. You set the sword down on your bed and begin focusing on it.
It's rather difficult to lift, your powers still rather limited due to how much mass your body still had, but the sword did slowly, and shakily, rise from the bed on your whim. You are speechless, your mouth hanging agape as you marveled at your new powers. You levitate the blade up above you towards the ceiling and stuck your right arm out, making sure it was in line with the sword. You released your psychic grip on the weapon and just as planned it dropped to the floor cleaving your remaining limb right off at the shoulder. You feel another great surge of power rush through you as you lose feeling in your arm, and testing your abilities out you immediately see the results. You concentrate on the sword once more and it lifts with ease, the same amount of effort it would take to actually carry it, and what's more you could maneuver it in ways that would be impossible if you still had your arms. Moving your concentration to your t-shirt you easily bring it over your head and redress yourself, the empty sleeves dangling odd of your shoulders in a way that you inexplicably found amusing. Getting an idea you lift the sword with your mind and hack your severed arms into further pieces, severing the hands at the wrists before levitating a pair of gloves out of your drawer and placing them on your hands before levitating your hands up to approximately where they would naturally hang from your body. You looked in the mirror and laughed, your little Rayman cosplay, flexing your fingers though you couldn't actually feel them. Using one of your floating hands you grab...
15533311.title: ...Cut off one or both of your arms!

155333111.content:
You lift your cellphone out of your pocket using your psychic power but find that you are unable to dial her number on the touch screen in the same manner. "Huh, I guess my psychic powers don't conduct electricity." You comment, vaguely remembering how capacitive touchscreens work. Using one of your corporeal hands you dial successfully and hold the phone to your ear, wanting nothing more than for Michelle to witness how cool this thing was! Right as the ringing stops you begin speaking, so excited you didn't even wait for Michelle to say hello. "Baby, it's me. You've GOT to come over here, I've got something incredible to show you!"
"Uh, okay. You've kind of caught me at a bad time here. I'm in the middle of a movie right now and I have to return it to the video store in two hours. Could you wait a little or is it an emergency?" She responds.
"I'll pay the late fee, I'll buy you the damn movie if you come over here asap!" You decree.
Michelle sighs "Alright, but I'm going to hold to that you know? This is actually a pretty good movie." With that she hangs up, leaving you to your own devices while you awaited her arrival. You mostly just messed around with your hands, floating them around the house without looking to see how well you had memorized the place. While you occasionally bumped into walls and got turned around one or two times you were able to successfully bring a glass of water from the kitchen, a book from the living room, and a condom taken from the bathroom's medicine cabinet back to your room before Michelle arrived.
Rather than walking down to greet her you sit on your bed and send your hands floating off to the front door, opening it wide before waving at her. She does not react well.

After waking her up, calming her down, and explaining the longsword Michelle seemed far more interested. "Trading body parts for telepathy? That's crazy!" She says, taking a sip of water.
"Psychokinesis" You correct. "You can't read minds or anything, you can just move physical objects."
Michelle shrugs. "You know what I meant. Anyway I have a great idea for what I want to do with the sword." She announces. What does she plan to do with it?

1553331112.content:
"Do you remember my friend Amber from back in high school?" She asked, acting as though it had been years rather than a few short weeks.
"Vaguely, yeah. I remember meeting her a couple of times when she was hanging out with you but in the last few weeks of school it seemed as though she just dropped off of the map. I don't even remember seeing her at graduation." You muse.
Michelle frowned. "Well there's a reason for that. Amber got into a car accident three weeks before the end of school. She survived, but got terrible burns and scars all over her arms, legs, and some on her body and had to sit out the graduation while she was in the hospital. The only reason it wasn't highly publicized around school was due to the circumstances of the accident, something about one of the drivers being the son of some rich politician and on drugs or something. Really hushed up the whole thing."
"I see, sorry to hear that. But how does this relate to the long sword?" You ask.
"Because, Amber could use it to become mobile and independent again! She lost most of her fingers and can hardly move her limbs ever since the accident, but this sword could give her her life back!" She announced.
"That's... really altruistic of you." You say, feeling a bit guilty that you were just going to use the sword to have fun.
Michelle smiles. "Plus I've known her for years and can tell you right now that she's... a bit freaky, if you catch my drift."
You now return her smile. "Alright, sounds like a plan then!" Rather than reconnecting your arms you levitate a jacket over and position your hands so that they are coming out of the sleeves, giving the illusion that you had arms in case someone looked your way. Next you grab one of your dad's old golf bags and stuff the sword and your arm s into it before slinging it over your back and walking out the door with Michelle following right behind you. You begin driving while she directs you to her friend Amber's house, finding it a bit tricky at times to keep the sleeves up and your hands moving right and concentrate on the road AND listen to Michelle's directions all at once, your psychic powers straining somewhat, but you manage to get there without incident. The two of you walk up to the door and knock, then proceed to wait almost a whole minute as a slow, electric sound edges towards the door. "Who is it?" Calls the voice inside, one belonging to a teenage girl.
"It's me, Michelle. Are your parents home?" She inquired.
"Oh, hi Michelle!" She chirps with giddy. "No, my parents are away right now, won't be back for another two hours or so. It's been the first time in a while they've left me home alone, probably because I'm more mobile now!" She say, the door opening electronically to show Amber and her new mobility, an electric wheelchair.
You and Amber studied one another, Amber not expecting anyone to be with Michelle and you not really having understood how severe the damage was. Amber was dressed in a sleeveless blue shin length skirt rather thin and showing off all manner of scars. Her arms were scarred, misshapen, and ended with only one or two warped fingers on each. Her legs were withered and also bent at odd angles. Amber's body looked to be in rather good shape, you imagine she was on a sports team of some kind before the accident as it still looked pretty toned despite putting on a little bit of weight due to the inactivity of the past few weeks. Her face was untouched save for one long thin scar her right cheek past where the right earlobe probably resided before the accident and one red splotch on her chin. It was a pretty face, its beauty shining through the damage. "Who's he?" Amber asked hesitantly.
"Hi, I'm Michelle's boyfriend John." You say. "What if I told you that you could even more mobility back?" You ask,using your powers to drop your jacket off revealing your floating hands.
Amber is stunned. "I... how?"
"May we come in?" You ask, not wanting to stay outside too long like this. Amber rolls her chair back and both you and Michelle enter her home, Michelle closing the door behind her. You drop the golf bag on the ground and allow your hands out of your psychic grip to really show Amber what you could do. "Earlier today I found a sword. Not just any sword, a magic one. One that could grant the user incredible powers." You explain, unzipping the bag and levitating the sword in the air. "Whatever part of someone gets cut off by this sword goes numb, BUT they gain the ability to move things witht their mind! The more parts they cut off, the stronger their powers get. Mind over matter, if you will." You explain. "As well, anything cut off can be reattached, even if it's on the wrong spot or on the wrong person! It'll work just as well as the real thing, but it also makes you easier to be moved by psychics. Sort of a balance thing if you will." You explain to her.
Amber stares at the sword, her eyes filling with emotion. "So, I could move like I used to?"
You smile. "Better." You toss the bag across the room on a whim, then lift each piece of furniture one by one (though you struggle with some of the heavier stuff).
"THAT'S AMAZING!" She squeals. "COULD YOU USE IT ON ME?!"
"That's the plan." Michelle says. "So, what would you like cut off?"
Amber answers...
